name: allusiveness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of containing things that make you think of another particular thing, person, or idea: His poetry is simple, lucid, with a touch of allusiveness. Allusiveness runs through all literature. See
allusive
More examplesFewer examplesThe university course examines rock music, its songs, and the allusiveness of their lyrics.The piece was choreographed with the abstract allusiveness for which Ms Brown is world-renowned.His writing, distinctive in its erudition and allusiveness, encompassed essays, poetry, and experimental fiction.
